text: Theorem (Pumping Lemma - contrapositive form) Let A be a language. Suppose that the following property holds: (=P) Forallp > 0, there exists a string w € A with|w| > p such that, for all x, y, zwithw = xyz , y £ € and |xy| < p, there exists i > 0 such that xy'z & A. Then, A is not regular. that (~P) holds of A
